page.title: 12BOWNESS-ON-SOLWAY. POLITICS.
page.content: The Parliamentary Member for Penrith & The Border is David Maclean,Cons., July 1983. Cumbria and N. Lancashire Member of European Parliament is Mrs. S. Frith, Conservative, elected May 1984. Local councillors are Ormond Holliday (Cons., Cumbria County Council, Silloth, Holme Abbey Ward); John Holliday, Farmer, (Cons., Allerdale District, Marsh Ward), both re-elected unopposed. Cumbria has a balanced Council (39 Labour, 36 Cons., 5 Liberal, 3 Ind) & there is much manoeuvring for power and control. Bowness Parish Council has 11 members from all parts of the Parish. For 1985/6 a Rate of 2p has been levied. This raises about Â£2600 which is allocated within the Parish, e.g. Â£200 for Parish Burial Ground;Â£500 for Lindow Hall.Some money is reserved for Bowness sea-wall repairs as needed.
